means: 婆罗门（印度种姓制度中最高等级或僧侣阶级）

sentence.Network_en: He joined Holems and the others under the Brahmin umbrella.
sentence.Network_cn: 他加入了霍姆斯等人的绅士派文人行列.

sentence.Network_en: Lowell , a thorough Brahmin , produced in his dialect'Biglow Papers'an important example of " native " American Literture.
sentence.Network_cn: 洛威尔彻头彻尾是个绅士派, 就曾以他的文言写成了《比格罗诗稿》,成为美国 “ 本土 ” 文学一个重要的范例.

sentence.Network_en: It is also good to be a Brahmin.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这世上,事奉沙门是乐,事奉婆罗门也是乐.

PerfectNetExp.abs: My father , an orthodox brahmin , never accepted gifts from the sudras ., 我的父亲是一个传统的婆罗门 , 从来不会接受首陀罗的赠品.

list.abs: Sashi and Sarat were two cousins who came from a pious brahmin family of Calcutta .萨西和萨拉特是一对表兄弟，来自加尔各答一个虔诚的婆罗门家庭。
My father , an orthodox brahmin , never accepted gifts from the sudras ., 我的父亲是一个传统的婆罗门 , 从来不会接受首陀罗的赠品.

entry.tran: 婆罗门（印度社会等级中的最高等级成员）
entry.def: A Brahmin is a Hindu of the highest social rank.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of a social and cultural elite (especially a descendant of an old New England family);
2. a member of the highest of the four Hindu varnas;
3. the highest of the four varnas: the priestly or sacerdotal category

auth_sentence.content: He came from a high-caste Brahmin background.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He came from a high-caste Brahmin background.

auth_sentence.content: Likewise, high level, or Brahmin, students extend invitations to low caste Hindus and tribal students.

auth_sentence.content: Bo Xilai was a Beijing Brahmin the tall, camera-ready son of a Party boss.
